job_title: Student Grader in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Able to do this while going to school at Rose-Hulman.
cons: Amount of work/hours dependent on professor, very little work for some.

job_title: Athletic Coach in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Benefits. RHIT used to be a wonderful place.
cons: Institute has changed. HR has terrorized the place for last few years. RHIT genuinely felt like a family atmosphere before they hired present HR staff. Currently an abomination. Wokeness and laughable attempts at forced diversity prevail over hard work and loyalty. Buyer beware.

job_title: Professor in Terre Haute, IN

cons: not much diversity, especially in the town

job_title: Associate Professor in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Collegial environment, great benefits, wonderful students
cons: Terre Haute has fewer amenities than larger cities.

job_title: Student Activities Staff in Terre Haute, IN
pros: The office coordinators there are all very friendly and nice. It's a great environment to work and scheduling of the work based on academic rigor is very flexible.
cons: The pay could be a bit higher, but I won't complain because it's such a nice place to work!

job_title: Career Advisor in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Great Community of people - very student success oriented
cons: I have no complaints about Rose

job_title: Teacher´s Assistant in Terre Haute, IN
pros: It helps reinforce my learning
cons: Not good if your understanding of the course is poor

job_title: Assistant Professor in Terre Haute, IN
pros: I had many supportive colleagues and the college had a family-like atmosphere. The students are talented and generally interested in learning. It was possible to teach a range of courses including a course I designed.
cons: There's a fair amount of bullying by tenured faculty. Standards have shifted such that there are people stuck at the associate professor level who have not stayed up to date in their fields. I had a faculty member tell me repeatedly that it was more important to be liked by tenured faculty than it is to be good at teaching. Another repeatedly told me he hadn't voted to hire me and didn't feel that I'd be a fit at the school or in Terre Haute.

job_title: Web Programming in Terre Haute, IN
pros: easy workload, good for students
cons: Nothing to complain about honestly

review_title: Everything is Good Except the Pay
job_title: Tutor in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Good work environment, very helpful and patient administration.
cons: Not paid enough for the quality of work the tutors provide.

job_title: Custodian in Terre Haute, IN
pros: It feels like everyone is a family

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Terre Haute, IN
pros: It is a great place to extent your skill set and knowledge. Faculty and staff are very supportive.

review_title: Great Place to learn how to lead a team
job_title: Summer Maintenance Supervisor in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Flexible time frames and ability to pick up weekend shifts. It's part-time so its easy to get time off if you need it.
cons: Some workers won't be around for long since you work with college students, so you need to teach new people how things run every year.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Rose values their employees and puts them first in each situation I've experienced since working there. The benefits and pay are more than fair and the climate is very professional and team oriented.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Have had a great experience here. Met a lot of amazing people and have learned a ton even outside of the classroom.

review_title: Easy to learn work study job

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Terre Haute, IN

job_title: Career Advisor in Terre Haute, IN

review_title: Excellent peers, great opportunity to work  with STEM students, Intense work atmosphere
job_title: Assistant Professor Mathematics (Tenure Track) in Terre Haute, IN
pros:
1) Only engineering, science and math students.
2) Individual interaction with students
3) Great peers and staff. 
4) Like a big family
5) Benefits and salary great for location.
6) Small town
cons:
1) Intense work environment
2) Wide variation in student abilites at 1st and 2nd year levels.
3) Expectation of teaching excellence and publishing while teaching 2-3  courses 4-5 days a week.
4) Increasing enrollment has  increased 1st year class  sizes to more than 30 students.
5) Academic facilities are woefully archaic. Majority of buildings and classrooms are in adequate for modern teaching  methods. 
6) Small town that is not a college town. Very few employment opportunities for professionals.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Great people that always want to further your professional development. Wonderful benefits and a great campus to drive into each day. Great on-site dining options.
cons: Some resistance to change. Red tape for many decisions. But that seems to be the case at many higher education jobs. While I like all the people in my department, some other departments have some people that are difficult to work with.

review_title: While I was a student I worked as a researcher, lab tech, and operations director for the radio station
job_title: Researcher, Lab Tech, Operations Director in Terre Haute, IN
pros:
The people are wonderful.
The open door policy is unprecedented and awesome.
You will find no brighter, kinder, and more diligent collection of staff, faculty, and students. period.
cons:
Studying at RHIT is an 'engineering boot camp' ... for four years.
A great deal is expected of all students but there is more than enough support to accomplish goals

job_title: Intern in Terre Haute, IN
pros:
Very flexible in regards to college schedules
Good experience working with companies
Good experience working with other students in a business environment
Near Rose-Hulman
Chance to experience major without committing to a full-time job
Good resume builder, particularly for a college student
cons:
People tend to work at different times, so communication between teammates can be difficult
Projects vary widely in regards to necessary skills, level of difficulty, etc.
Temporary (only hire interns)
Many of the projects are fairly trivial or monotonous, as they are contracted by outside companies who are usually unwilling to commit their own people to doing the job

job_title: Database Programmer in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Great retirement and health care plan. Salary above average, good perks and employee benefits. Facilities are great and there are a lot of good people there.
cons: Some of the "attitudes" that come across as negative are condescending, demeaning, patronizing and judgemental. Don't ever get sick or old - there is at least one discrimination suit against them now.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Good education, quality faculty, great engineering experience. Access to good internships. Career fair is a very good place to find employment.
cons: Secluded from the rest of the world. Somewhat depressing atmosphere. Some professors are stuck up. Too much work for the reward.

review_title: "Fun and Easy Work as a Student"
job_title: Desk Clerk in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Since the school focuses on Academics first, most on-campus jobs schedule around the class schedule.  You get paid to work and when there is down time, you are encouraged to do homework or study.
cons: For most jobs, they require work study/work opportunity but as the school year progresses some jobs open up for those without work study/work opportunity.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Smart, engaged employees all pulling for a common cause -- educating our future scientists and engineers.  Great 'corporate culture', plenty of interesting learning opportunities, and excellent facilities.  This is a place where you can feel good about going to work every day.
cons: Very flat organizational structure leaves little opportunity for promotion.

job_title: Marketing in Terre Haute, IN
pros: If you are looking to work at a creative and challenging higher ed school, this is the place to be. Small community, and wonderful people to work with. The faculty and staff are very passionate and sincere about what they do. Good pay, good benefits and family oriented.
cons: Turnover at the executive level has created some challenges.

job_title: Perky and Driven to Succeed in Terre Haute, IN
pros: Friendly; punctional; open to learn something new everyday ; staying with jobs for long periods of time
cons: Always keep a smile on face in any type of situation
